channel.description: Recent content in WAT on datanerds.io

item.title: WAT - Cassandra: Row level consistency #$@&%*!
item.description:
TL;DR Cassandra is not row level consistent!!!

We published a blog post about some surprising and unexpected behaviors while using Apache Cassandra/DataStax Enterprise some weeks back. Recently, we encountered even more WAT moments and I believe this one is the most distressing.

In a nutshell: We discovered corrupted data and it took us a while to understand what was happening and why that data was corrupt. Let’s dive into the problem:

item.title: WAT - Cassandra
item.description:
When using Cassandra*, you sometimes have these WAT moments. If you don’t know what we are talking about, just take a short detour.

Taking a step back and figuring out what things are built for is usually a good idea, so what was Cassandra envisioned for?

Cassandra does not support a full relational data model; instead, it provides clients with a simple data model that supports dynamic control over data layout and format.
